name: Coombe Hill Woodland Walk, Central Chilterns

ai.summary: Coombe Hill Woodland Walk is a 10.9 km circular hike in the Central Chilterns (UK) featuring shaded woodland trails, gentle climbs, and open viewpoints around Coombe Hill. The route is moderate in difficulty, suitable for those with steady footing and some hiking experience, including families with appropriate footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: The hike traverses a mix of surfaced woodland paths, packed earth, and some muddy sections after rain. Expect gentle ascents and descents, exposed tree roots in shaded sections, and a few short flights of steps or gates near the Coombe Hill area. Much of the route runs through woodland with occasional open viewpoints over rolling Chilterns countryside.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths and check weather forecasts before setting out. The higher sections can be exposed in windy conditions, so bring appropriate clothing and sun protection in summer. Ground can be muddy after rain; wear waterproof footwear. Watch for uneven ground and roots, keep dogs under control, and carry a map or GPS. Park in designated areas and follow local access rules. Carry a phone with emergency numbers and a basic first aid kit.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight (for low light moments)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; the walk is enjoyable year-round with the right gear, with late spring and autumn offering the best views and colors.
